intro: Androsaemum emarginatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cowslip, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often slightly notched at the edges. Its flowers are yellow and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
